cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest across Hispaniola, then near the Turks & Caicos and SE Bahamas Thursday, skirting the N coast of Cuba Friday, and turning northwest toward the eastern Gulf of Mexico and the Florida Panhandle/ Alabama coast by early Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern Gulf Coast near the FL-AL border
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system forecast to move inland well west of the Georgia coast and never pass offshore of Brunswick)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Dominican Republic south coast Punta Palenque eastward, north coast east of Haiti border; northern Haiti coast; Turks & Caicos; SE Bahamas; several Cuban provinces
weather_observation.warning_coast: Dominican Republic south coast Punta Palenque eastward and north coast east of Haiti border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, SE and central Bahamas, north-central Cuba, South Florida, Florida Keys, eastern Gulf Coast from the Keys to the Florida Panhandle and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible Tuesday as the weakening inland system passes west of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic Georgia coast because the center stays in the Gulf of Mexico then inland
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain possible 16–18 Aug, generally 1–3 inches with isolated higher totals; localized ponding on port access roads could occur
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and rip currents along the Georgia beaches early next week
